abstract: Polish Pres Andrzej Duda signs amendment into law that requires Constitutional Tribunal, country's highest court, to adopt most rulings by two-thirds majority with at least 13 judges present; critics say move will paralyze court and upend government's system of checks and balances.
lead_paragraph: The new law which affects how Poland’s highest court makes rulings, is a move that critics say will paralyze the court and erode checks and balances on government powers.

headline.main: Poland: Law Altering Top Court Goes Into Effect Despite Criticism
headline.print_headline: Europe; Poland: Law Altering Top Court Goes Into Effect Despite Criticism

snippet: The new law which affects how Poland’s highest court makes rulings, is a move that critics say will paralyze the court and erode checks and balances on government powers.
